poem:
Title: "Fragmented under the Same Sky"

Nightclub murmur brought close,
Humorous sorrow whispered -
"I wish we had German vaginas."
Borne of Germany, bound by the homeland.
Two flowers bloom from the same root,
Yet, scattered petals dance to different tunes. 
In the corners of the out-spoken,
Unveil the unspeakable truth,
Young women whispering freedoms
In the confines of the impending dusk.
